Learn what programming is: Programming is the process of creating a set of instructions that tell a computer how to perform a task.
Learn HTML Basics: HTML is the standard markup language used to create web pages. It defines the structure of a webpage using tags.
Learn CSS Basics: CSS is used to style HTML elements. It controls the layout, colors, fonts, and overall appearance.
Create your first webpage: Combining HTML and CSS, you can build a basic webpage that displays content and styles.
Learn basic JavaScript: JavaScript is a programming language that lets you add interactivity to your website, like buttons and animations.
Master HTML5 & Semantic Tags: HTML5 introduces new elements and attributes that help structure your content semantically.
CSS Layout: Flexbox, Grid: Flexbox and Grid are CSS layout models that allow you to create complex layouts easily.
JavaScript DOM Manipulation: The Document Object Model (DOM) represents the structure of a webpage. JavaScript can manipulate it to change content dynamically.
Git & GitHub: Git is a version control system that tracks changes in your code. GitHub is a platform for hosting and collaborating on Git repositories.
React Basics: React is a JavaScript library for building user interfaces. It allows you to create reusable components.
Learn Python Basics: Python is a beginner-friendly programming language. It is widely used for web development, data science, and AI.
Learn NumPy: NumPy is a Python library used for working with arrays. It is essential for mathematical and scientific computing.
Learn Pandas: Pandas is a Python library for data manipulation and analysis. It allows you to work with data in tables and spreadsheets.
Intro to Machine Learning: Machine Learning allows computers to learn from data and make predictions. It is a core part of AI.
Train your first AI model: You can train your first AI model using Python libraries like Scikit-learn or TensorFlow by feeding labeled data into an algorithm.
